data.title: Etihad signs with Saudi Arabia’s Al Ittihad
data.meta_description: Abu Dhabi carrier becomes soccer club’s official airline.
data.text:
Saudi Arabian soccer side Al Ittihad FC have agreed a deal with Etihad to become the club’s official airline.

The agreement will see the Abu Dhabi carrier receive branding at home matches and training, access to the club’s players for marketing activities and a presence at press conferences and other official events. Financial terms of the deal were not released.

Etihad will also be the preferred airline for the club and supporter travel when they fly abroad for the Asian Champions League competition.

The president of Al Ittihad FC, Ibrahim Al-Balawi, said: “The partnership gives us an opportunity to extend our reach outside of the traditional market of Saudi Arabia and into other areas of the world such as Asia, where we also have a strong following in our fan base thanks to our success in the Asian Champions League.”

Etihad becomes official airline partner of MLS

Peter Baumgartner, the chief commercial officer for Etihad Airways, said: “We have an extremely successful track record in sports sponsorship and our latest role as official airline of Al Ittihad complements Etihad Airways’ existing partnerships with Manchester City, Melbourne City and New York City football clubs.

“Saudi Arabia is one of our most important markets and we are delighted to support a team based in our home region.”

Jeddah-based Al Ittihad currently play in the Abdul Latif Jameel League, the top professional soccer division in Saudi Arabia.

Etihad has deals in place with a number of soccer clubs, including Manchester City, Melbourne City and New York City.
